This is but one of the legends of which the people speak... Long ago, there existed a kingdom where a golden power lay hidden. It was a prosperous land blessed with green forests, tall mountains, and peace. But one day, a man of great evil found the golden power and took it for himself. With its strength at his command, he spread darkness across the kingdom. But then, when all hope had died, and the hour of doom seemed at hand, a young boy clothed in green appeared as if from nowhere. Wielding the blade of evil's bane, he sealed the dark one away and gave the land light.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]What became of that kingdom? None remain who know.

O, wise Princess Zelda, throughout the ages you have defied evil and bore the burdens of your ancestors without complaint or struggle. Your wisdom has been passed down to you by the Gods, and those same Gods have entrusted you with your nation's fate. They want you to carry forward the power, courage and wisdom that they bestowed upon their chosen prophets and pass it down to the people, all whilst protecting them from the dangers of greed and corruption. Will you accept, Princess Zelda? Will you allow Hyrule to become a civilization that stands the test of time?
Princess Zelda
The wise princess

Throughout Hyrule's history there have been an untold number of princesses with the name Zelda. Typically they have all had some significant part to play in defending the realm from the power of evildoers, either by command or often even leading armies into battle herself. The name Zelda has been long associated with the wisest people in all the land.

A kind and benevolent royal, the princess is unafraid to interact with the common people, often forming long-lasting relationships with Sheikah and her royal guard that prove important in moving the realm forward. As such, she is seen as a keen diplomat.

Zelda holds the Triforce of Wisdom, a piece of the legendary Triforce thatis said to grant wishes to those who hold all three pieces. She protects it in secret so that it does not fall into the wrong hands.

The Hylian race is the majority civilization in Hyrule. They believe themselves to be put in Hyrule by the Goddesses themselves and as such are a very religious and proud people. They tell tales of the world being forged by Din, Farore and Nayru, and tales of the legendary Triforce.

Hyrule has frequently been under assault by evildoers, most frequently and notably the immortal, evil theif-king Ganon. Using the power bestowed upon to them by the Godesses, and the efforts of Princess Zelda and her royal guard, including a boy garbed in green, they have often - although not always - managed to repel these invasions.
